summary: Simple launcher to run the game maximized with a borderless window.
descriptionHtml:
[COLOR=green][SIZE=4][B]Simple Borderless Window[/B][/SIZE][/COLOR]

SBW is a launcher that launches the game, and removes the borders. Also gets around some bugs associated with alt+tabbing.


[COLOR=orange][SIZE=3][B]Compatibility[/B][/SIZE][/COLOR]

This should work with all versions of Skyrim up to 1.9.

SBW should also detect and run Skyrim Script Extender if installed. Last tested with SKSE 1.6.13.


[COLOR=orange][SIZE=3][B]Instructions[/B][/SIZE][/COLOR]

Setting your resolution:
1. Launch Skyrim via the normal launcher, \"SkyrimLauncher.exe\" or using Steam. Select Options then select \"Windowed Mode\" and your desired resolution (usually the size of your screen resolution).

If the resolution you want is not selectable, you can edit \"SkyrimPrefs.ini\" in your \"Documents\\My Games\\Skyrim\" folder. Just find the lines \"iSize H\" and \"iSize W\" and change them to your desired resolution.

Setting up SBW:
1. Extract SBW.exe from the download.

2. If you want SBW to run SKSE/Skyrim automatically, move \"SBW.exe\" into the \"skyrim\" folder where \"TESV.exe\" is located, this is usually in \"Steam/steamapps/common/skyrim\". Then run \"SBW.exe\".
OR
2. Manually run Skyrim and SBW in any order you want, however you want, from wherever you want, with what ever loaders and injectors and hacks you want.

3. Press CTRL+ENTER in game to activate SBW.


[COLOR=orange][SIZE=3][B]Tray Menu[/B][/SIZE][/COLOR]

Additional options are available in the tray menu.

[B]Cursor Fix[/B]
Fixes the mouse issue when alt+tabbing back into the game. The caveat of this feature is that you will get no mouse cursor for the Steam overlay, but who needs the Steam overlay when you can so easily alt+tab to the full Steam with SBW! This function is ON by default.

[B]Force minimise[/B]
Forces the game to minimise when alt+tabbing out of the game. This helps fixes the issue of the mouse cursor not appearing. This function is OFF by default.

[B]Additional Hotkeys[/B]
Allows customisation of the game window when activated via some hotkeys:
CTRL + Up/Down/Left/Right - Move window by 5 pixels.
ALT + Up/Down/Left/Right - Resize window by 5 pixels.
With the above you can also press Shift to move by 1 pixel instead.


[COLOR=orange][SIZE=3][B]INI Settings[/B][/SIZE][/COLOR]

SBW can save and load its settings via the tray menu. Settings will be stored in a file named \"SBW.ini\" where SBW is located.

If you have changed a setting and want to keep it, remember to click \"Save settings\" again, SBW does not do this automatically.

SBW will automatically load settings from INI on start up. \"Load settings\" is only used if you changed something manually in the INI while SBW is running or if you want to revert any changes you made.

All settings are optional and can be omitted if you want the default value to be used instead.

Example:
[Settings]
Cursor=1
Force=0
Keys=0
X=0
Y=0
Width=1920
Height=1080

[B]Cursor/Force/Keys[/B]
Turn Cursor fix/Force minimise/Hotkeys modes on or off. 0 for off, any whole number above 0 for on.

[B]X/Y[/B]
The X/Y position SBW will move game window to, relative to the top left of your primary monitor. Must be a positive or negative whole number.

[B]Width/Height[/B]
The size SBW will resize the game window to. Must be a positive whole number.


[COLOR=orange][SIZE=3][B]Additional INI Settings[/B][/SIZE][/COLOR]

These settings can be added in the INI file manually and can\'t be configured using the tray menu.

Example:
[Settings]
Delay=12000
Launch=SkyrimHacks.exe

[B]Delay[/B]
Delay in milliseconds before SBW automatically activates. If you want to use this feature, I recommend 12000 (12 seconds) as a starting point.

[B]Launch[/B]
Custom executable to launch, if you want to launch something else rather then SKSE/Skyrim first.


[COLOR=orange][SIZE=3][B]Issues[/B][/SIZE][/COLOR]

Here is a list of issues and some tips on how to avoid them.

[B]SBW not modifying game window or doing anything:[/B]
Although normally not needed, run SBW as administrator or disable UAC in Windows. Also remember to press CTRL+ENTER.

[B]Brightness doesn\'t effect the game:[/B]
A problem which effects most if not all games. In the case of Skyrim, ENB mods or similar can help.

[B]Lower FPS:[/B]
Window mode for any game can be more resource demanding.

[B]Program not responding or white screen or windows loading cursor or slow load times:[/B]
Another resource issue here, ALT+TAB during loading screens is a bit risky, please be patient and do so with caution.

[B]Black bars or borders:[/B]
Make sure your resolution in Skyrim is set properly. Classic theme and/or disabling Visual Styles on Windows may also help. Also try not to press CTRL+ENTER during the intro movie, or any movies for that matter, and not in any loading screens or under any load.

[B]Mouse doesn\'t work after leaving game:[/B]
Right click anywhere, then try again. I no have idea why this sometimes happens.
author: Liddo
